descriptionHtml:
*** 22 Colored Fog and Softened Shade ***


2.0 Change log:

Updated: ver 2.0 Change Log and Explanation

I adjusted Ambient colors more realistic.
Furthermore, I added very dark ambient mode, called “Dark Shade”.

You can choose the weather colors by an amulet.
It is automatically added and using no slot.
When you equip it, select menu will pop out.

“Reset” will set the weather to normal climate.
If you want it back immediately, use “wait” for an hour after choosing reset.

Colored fogs are thickened by shortening the depth of far plane fog.
And, I weakened the blur of simple RGB fog (that is the three of “Mono and RGB”) for trimming.

I set qasmoke cell to behave as exterior.
You can change the weather like as exterior.
If not, put my mod in the last of your load order.

If you use previous version, please overwrite the esp :)
Clean save & install is not needed.

[youtube]CJwMpZovasA[/youtube]


-------1.1 description-------


This mod adds different colors of fog for SKYRIM Screenshot.
I made these colored background mainly for taking a picture of your character, which is like an illustration.

It's usable only in EXTERIOR.
There are 22 new Weather IDs.
I tweaked their lighting softer than black and striking shade of Vanilla SKYRIM.

Compatible with any Weather Mods, Lighting Mods, and ENBs.
I recommend highly tktk1's "Face Light" [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/13457/]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/13457/[/url]
And also recommend "CLO" [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/21642]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/21642[/url] to adjust the sky brightness for architecture and mountain ridge.
Mods used in screenshots:
"Kankara-ya" by KANRA
"Enhanced Character Edit 0.9x beta" by tktk
(They are plannning to upload their mods in Nexus soon)


How to Use

1. Install and activate this esp.
2. Open the console screen, and use the two commands below.
3. fw xx00080y 1 (xx=FormID, y=0 to 9, a to f...etc. ForceWeather [WeatherID] 1=the weather lasts long)
4. setfog 200 300 (You can change the value as you want. SetFog [StartDepth] [EndDepth])
5. Say cheese!

Command to reset the setting:
fw 81a
setfog 0 0

Reference:
Console Command
[url=http://elderscrolls.wikia.com/wiki/Console_Commands_(Skyrim)]http://elderscrolls.wikia.com/wiki/Console_Commands_(Skyrim)[/url]
"Force Weather" command
[url=http://elderscrolls.wikia.com/wiki/Console_Commands_(Skyrim)/Weather]http://elderscrolls.wikia.com/wiki/Console_Commands_(Skyrim)/Weather[/url]


How to Find FormID
[size=3][color=#f09199][b]Use the command "help 22fog 0", the first two numbers are FormID! :) (v1.1)[/b][/color][/size]
You can find FormID correctly in WryeBash, NMM, or tes5edit.
It is the number of your load order.

00 Skyrim.esm
01 Update.esm
02
03
04
05
06
07
08
09

0a
0b
0c
0d
0e
0f

10
11
12
13
14...........

So, this mod's esp should be put the first. That's simple. It's easy to count.

For example, when you put it 13th and the formID is 0c, the weatherID is like this below:
c000800
c000801
c000802
...
c000809
c00080a
c00080b
...
c00080f
c000810
c000811
...
c000815

author: AltheaR
